verbs.description: conglobulate (third-person singular simple present conglobulates, present participle conglobulating, simple past and past participle conglobulated)

entries.meaning: (rare, intransitive) To collect together into a compact round mass.
examples: ‘Swallows certainly sleep all the winter. A number of them conglobulate together, by flying round and round, and then all in a heap throw themselves under water, and lye in the red of a river.’
